pages.name: Spousal Support
pages.description:
Spousal support is money that one spouse pays to another spouse for their financial support after separation. It is different from child support.
A person is only entitled to spousal support in certain situations. It is not a right in every case. There are rules under the Family Law Act about what makes you a spouse and when you can ask for an order for spousal support.
You can apply for spousal support if:
  • you are a spouse because:
  • You were married
  • You lived together in a marriage-like relationship for at least two years, or
  • You lived in a marriage-like relationship for less than two years, but you have a child together
  • you can prove entitlement to the court for spousal support, and
  • you are applying in time (Married spouses must start a court proceeding claiming spousal support within two years of the date of their divorce or an order annulling their marriage. Unmarried spouses must start a court proceeding within two years of the date of their separation).

choices.text: I am a person acting on behalf of the child
A parent or guardian of the child(ren)
A person standing in the place of a parent to the child(ren) [for example step parent]

elements.name: howChildSpendTimeWithParties
elements.title: Describe how the child(ren) spend time with the parties
elements.description:
The amount of time a child lives with each parent or guardian may determine who may be required to pay child support. The time a child lives with each parent or guardian includes the time that they are responsible for the child, even if the child is not physically with them.

If the child lives with more than one parent or guardian try to describe the amount of time they live with each parent over a period of one year. If you can estimate a percentage of time, it is helpful for the court. For example, if they live two days a week with one parent and the rest with the other, they live approximately 30% of the time with the first parent and 70% with the other.

If you have more than one child and the living arrangements are different for each child, try to be clear about the amount of time a time each child lives with each parent.

elements.name: parentingType
elements.title: Based on above, would you describe the arrangement as `split parenting` or `shared parenting` time?
elements.description: Parenting time may be shared equally by the parents, split between the parents, with one or more children each living with a different parent, or the children may live only or primarily with one parent.

elements.name: currentSupportArrangements
elements.title: The current support arrangements are as follows:
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording.  Just explain to the court how the child(ren) is/are currently being looked after financially.  Include:  how much money are you receiving or paying for the support of the child(ren), how often and when did these payments begin or stop.

elements.name: applicantIncome
elements.description: When a parent has an income over $150,000, the Federal Child Support Guidelines may apply a little differently. This information will help to determine if you need to provide more financial information to the court.

elements.name: otherPartyInformation
elements.title: I know the following facts about the other party's employment, training, health, and ability to work:
elements.description: The court requires financial information to be able to decide on a fair and proper amount for child support.  The other party will be asked to give their own financial information to the court, but if they do not, the court may impute income (decide how much income a person makes or should be making).  The court will look at the information you have provided about the other party's income, if known, and anything you know about things like the type of work they are doing or have done in the past, or any employment qualifications or training that they have, to make this decision. Only provide information you know. If you don't have any factual information, you can leave this section blank.
